intro: Agarista niederleinii var. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved agarista, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves with acute tips. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
